com.appacitive.android.model
Class AppacitiveObject

java.lang.Object
  com.appacitive.android.model.AppacitiveObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
AppacitiveUser
public class AppacitiveObject
extends java.lang.Object

An AppacitiveObject is a basic unit to store information in. It represents an instance of a schema. Data can be stored in key-value pairs in the properties and attributes fields.

Author:
Sandeep Dhull

Method Detail

addProperty

public void addProperty(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.Object value)
Method used to add an property to the AppacitiveObject. Attributes are used to store extra information.

Parameters:
key - key of the data item to be stored.
value - Corresponding value to the key.

addAttribute

public void addAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                         java.lang.Object value)
Adds a attruibute to an AppacitiveObject.

Parameters:
key - The Field For which the value needs to be set
value - The Value which is to be set

addTag

public void addTag(java.lang.String tag)
Method used to add a tag to the AppacitiveObject.

Parameters:
tag - The tag to be added to the AppacitiveObject.

saveObject

public void saveObject()
Save the article on the remote server. This method will save an article in the background. If save is successful the properties will be updated and no callback will be invoked.

saveObject

public void saveObject(AppacitiveCallback callback)
Save the article on the remote server. This method will save an article in the background. If save is successful the properties will be updated and the success callback will be invoked. If not the failure callback is invoked.

Parameters:
callback - Callback invoked when the save operation is successful or failed.

deleteObject

public void deleteObject()
Deletes the article on the remote server. This method will delete an article in the background. If deletion is successful or unsuccessful no callback will be invoked.

deleteObjectWithConnections

public void deleteObjectWithConnections(boolean deleteConnections,
                                        AppacitiveCallback callback)
Delete the article on the remote server. This method will delete an article in the background. If deletion is successful the success callback will be invoked. If not the failure callback is invoked.

Parameters:
deleteConnection - If this is true then all the APConnection associated with this AppacitiveObject also get detected.
callback - Callback invoked when the delete operation is successful or failed.

deleteObjectsWithIds

public static void deleteObjectsWithIds(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> objectIds,
                                        java.lang.String schemaName,
                                        AppacitiveCallback callback)
Deletes multiple AppacitiveObjects from the remote server.

Parameters:
objectIds - The ids of the objects to delete.
schemaName - The schema that the objects belong to.
callback - Callback invoked when the delete operation is successful or failed.

fetchObject

public void fetchObject(AppacitiveFetchCallback callback)
Fetches all the properties of an AppacitiveConnection object on which this method is invoked.

Parameters:
callback - Callback invoked when the fetch operation is successful or failed.

fetchObjectsWithIds

public static void fetchObjectsWithIds(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ids,
                                       java.lang.String schemaName,
                                       AppacitiveFetchCallback callback)
Retrieves multiple AppacitiveObject of a particular schema.

Parameters:
ids - The ids of the objects.
schemaName - The schema name the objects belong to.
callback - Callback invoked when the fetch operation is successful or failed.

searchAllObjects

public static void searchAllObjects(java.lang.String schemaName,
                                    AppacitiveFetchCallback callback)
Searches for all AppacitiveObjects of a particular schema.

Parameters:
schemaName - The schema name the objects belong to.
callback - Callback invoked when the search operation is successful or failed.

searchObjects

public static void searchObjects(java.lang.String schemaName,
                                 java.lang.String query,
                                 AppacitiveFetchCallback callback)
Searches for AppacitiveObjects and filters the results according to the query string.

Parameters:
schemaName - The schema name the objects belong to.
query - SQL kind of query to search for specific objects. For more info http://appacitive.com
callback - Callback invoked when the search operation is successful or failed.
